Description:
Introduction:This vacant position is for an international company opening up it’s third-party global outsourcing office; expected to be fully operational in Dubai October 2023! The company is one of North America’s leading carriers and specialize in the transportation and logistics industry. They are growing in many areas and are searching for talented individuals to lead their team!*This is an in-office, permanent, full-time role in Dubai, UAE.Position Summary:The ideal candidate should be an accounting professional that is self-driven, organized, and thrives in a fast-paced environment. They should be able to lead the teams based in Dubai and simultaneously coordinate/communicate with HO in Canada. They will manage the day-to-day financial operations of the organization, will plan and direct all accounting operational functions, manage the accumulation and consolidation of financial information for internal and external financial statements, assess accounting and internal control systems, and guide departmental staff. As a leader, you will encourage innovative ideas that are sound and progressive, challenge the status quo, and support creativity in your area of responsibility.Direct Report:·    Financial ControllerDuties & Responsibilities:Oversee, guide and manage the general operations of the finance department and accounting functions, including, but not limited to accounts payable, accounts receivable, billing, payroll, and internal auditing.
Engaging in and managing day-to-day financial transactions
Preparing cash-flow reports that project cash needs at weekly and monthly intervals, and handling daily cash management
Manage teams of Accounts Receivable, Billing, Accounts Payable and Internal Audit.
Prepare and present management reports, financial statements (internal & external) for all the subfunctions.
Lead scheduled weekly meetings with accounting teams
Follow up with Management regarding issues or concerns as required.
Preparing financial statements, both internal and external
Preparing monthly financial indicators as selected
Preparing cash flow analyses and budget variance analyses
Preparing special reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends
Participating in the budgeting processes.
Ensuring compliance with applicable rules, laws, and regulations
Providing company leaders with insights for decision-making purposes
Establishing and maintaining financial controls
Assessing and improving accounting processes and procedures; update and maintain SOP’s for designated teams
Screening, hiring, training, developing and retaining accounting department employees.
Follow up with team regarding various issues or concerns.
Perform ad hoc analysis and projects as required.Job Offer:Full-time (Permanent)Skills
Skills:
Minimum of 5+ years experience in a similar role handling a team independently
Transportation, trucking, logistics industry experience is highly preferred.
Team oriented and results driven using collaboration to achieve goals.
Quick learner and ability to manage multiple and competing priorities in a fast-paced work environment
Strong management skills with the ability to lead, mentor, and develop an accounting team of 10 to 15 people
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to work in fast paced environments while remaining efficient and detailed oriented
Excellent knowledge of advanced functions in Microsoft Excel
Proficiency in Microsoft applications including Word, and Outlook
Excellent Interpersonal skills
Knowledge of TMW (Truck Mate Software) will be an asset
Knowledge of Quick Books will be considered an asset
BA/BS in Accounting, Finance, Economics or other business related field (Required)
